metadata.synopsis: Oskar is in the Guildhall, working as a counterfeiter with the Zhentarim. If the player met him previously and refused/failed to help him, he's quite angry at them, but has nonetheless managed to create a more comfortable situation for himself. If the player never met him, he's simply a counterfeiter trying to sell them a fake painting he needs to offload.

30.speaker: Oskar Fevras
30.text: You left me in that bloody Zhentarim camp to rot.

9.speaker: Oskar Fevras
9.text: You're fortunate I've work to do, or I'd show you exactly where they like to stick a palette knife.

50.speaker: Oskar Fevras
50.text: The Zhentarim, of course. I've learned a trick or two from them since you abandoned me in their filthy encampment.

58.speaker: Oskar Fevras
58.text: I convinced them that a true artist cannot perform in captivity, and so we agreed to proceed on a mutually beneficial basis.

21.speaker: Oskar Fevras
21.text: Hardly the line of work I expected to end up in, but I can say one thing for them - they understand the value of art.

7.speaker: Oskar Fevras
7.text: Well, I'm not giving them away.

72.speaker: Oskar Fevras
72.text: Aha. Well, I wouldn't put it in quite those terms. I'm simply a duplicator of artistic works that already exist.

27.speaker: Oskar Fevras
27.text: If people can't tell the difference between my work and the original, then who's to say it is any less precious than the real thing?

70.speaker: Oskar Fevras
70.text: They are very reasonable people. I produce the work, and they handle the distribution.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Why not just return to your patron?

20.speaker: Oskar Fevras
20.text: Oh, I never asked. Why bother, when I'm finally an artist of independent means?

16.speaker: Oskar Fevras
16.text: I think it's going rather well. I've more gold in my pockets now than I ever had begging for Lady Jannath's scraps.

12.speaker: Oskar Fevras
12.text: It's a shame, but then the curse of true originality was always to be undervalued.

24.speaker: Oskar Fevras
24.text: Now if you'll excuse me, I've got orders to fulfil, and this Kalain won't forge itself.

47.speaker: Oskar Fevras
47.text: Oh, and if you're thinking about selling that to anyone down here - forget it. They aren't as stupid as they look. Or as friendly.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Ouch. I didn't take you for the violent type.

0.speaker: Oskar Fevras
0.text: Yes, well, enough time spent in violent captivity at the hands of brutal thugs will do that to a man.

51.speaker: Oskar Fevras
51.text: Fortunately, the Zhentarim stopped threatening to break my fingers when they realised it would be bad for business.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: What are you doing in the Guildhall?

73.speaker: Oskar Fevras
73.text: After you failed to rescue me from their encampment, the Zhentarim and I settled our differences, so to speak.

48.speaker: Oskar Fevras
48.text: You'll find out for yourself if you get on the wrong side of them. The Zhentarim aren't much for subtlety.

59.speaker: Oskar Fevras
59.text: They do, however, know the work of a master when they see it.

43.speaker: Oskar Fevras
43.text: Hmm. You look rather more refined than the usual thugs walking these halls. I don't suppose you have any interest in fine art?

14.speaker: Oskar Fevras
14.text: My name is Oskar Fevras, though I doubt you'll have heard it.

2.speaker: Oskar Fevras
2.text: My stardom has waned somewhat recently, but I was once feted as one of the city's most promising artists.

10.speaker: Oskar Fevras
10.text: These days my oeuvre is less original, shall we say, but no less in demand.

28.speaker: Oskar Fevras
28.text: In fact, you're fortunate to have caught me just now. I've a rather special piece that's become unexpectedly available.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Of course. There's nothing like art to soothe a troubled soul.

63.speaker: Oskar Fevras
63.text: Then perhaps I might be able to interest you in a rather special piece I've just completed. It's become unexpectedly available.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'm more interested in the purses required to buy such pieces.

11.speaker: Oskar Fevras
11.text: Aha. Then perhaps you'd be interested in taking a look at my stock. I've a rather special piece that's become unexpectedly available.

18.speaker: Oskar Fevras
18.text: I assure you, it's identical to the original down to the finest brush stroke. A fine piece to hang on the wall of anyone you decide to sell it to.

29.speaker: Oskar Fevras
29.text: Ah. We had a very interested party out in Waterdeep who, shall we say, commissioned the piece. But when the time came, she was unable to pay.

69.speaker: Oskar Fevras
69.text: I hear parts of her have washed up as far away as Neverwinter.

35.speaker: Oskar Fevras
35.text: Oh - and a word of advice. Don't try to sell it down here - I've already tried, and they aren't interested.

5.speaker: Oskar Fevras
5.text: Of course not! It's absolutely real - I painted it myself.

57.speaker: Oskar Fevras
57.text: It is simply derived from an existing source of inspiration.

17.speaker: Oskar Fevras
17.text: My good friend, do you know where you are? The Guildhall is no place for the morally squeamish.

76.speaker: Oskar Fevras
76.text: If, however, you're open to the idea of supporting the arts, then we may do some fine business.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I've no time for such distractions.

37.speaker: Oskar Fevras
37.text: Well, culture isn't for everyone. Perhaps gold is of more value to you, yes?

13.speaker: Oskar Fevras
13.text: I've a rather wonderful painting that's become unexpectedly available.

44.speaker: Oskar Fevras
44.text: Oh, wonderful. Back again, are we?
44.context: NodeContext: Super pissed off - you abandoned him with violent thugs. Low voice - doesn't want to be overheard
